title: North Cliffe Woods Walking Route

images.title: bernard bradley / Woodland trail and foxglove

images.caption: Path in North Cliffe Wood

images.title: Paul Lakin, CC BY 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: North Cliffe bluebells in the spring of 2013

description: This peaceful walk visits North Cliffe Woods in the East Riding of Yorkshire. The small woods are located just west of the hamlet of North Cliffe near South Newbald and Market Weighton. The woods are also a nature reserve with lots of flora and fauna to see. Look out for pretty bluebells in the spring, attractive birch woodland and wildlife including deer, blackcap, chiffchaff and warbler. You can park on a grass verge near the site and then follow about 2 miles of circular footpath. Good footwear is advised in the winter months when the paths can be quite muddy. There's another fine local nature reserve to visit in the shape of the North Cave Wetlands. These lie just to the south and include a pleasant circular footpath with waterside paths along a pretty lake.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: Dogs are not allowed at the site.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head a few miles north and you could visit Londesborough Park near Goodmanham. The estate has some good walking trails with lakes, streams and more woodland trails to enjoy. Just to the north you can pick up the Bubwith Rail Trail. This flat, easy path will take you along an old railway line toward Holme-on-Spalding-Moor and Market Weighton. To the south is the village of Hotham where you can enjoy a walk along the historic Hotham Hall Estate with its parkland, gardens and lakes.

display_address: Sand Lane, North Cliffe, South Cliffe, East Riding of Yorkshire, England, YO43 4XE, United Kingdom
